result.execSummary:
The defendant Bradly J. Richardson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Eau Claire County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Provide DNA sample and pay surcharge.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Bradly J. Richardson

records.addlTxt: Reminder Notice indicating amount due mailed to defendant.

(Cases 21CF410, 21CF1293, 22CF388 are called at 9:59 AM) Defendant Bradly J. Richardson in court.  Attorney Robert Allen Thorson in court for Bradly J. Richardson.  District Attorney Peter Rindal and Attorney Afton Lewis in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Defense indicates there is an agreement, however needs time to review paperwork. Off the record: 10:00 AM- 10:26 AM. 
Same appearance as listed above. Defense indicates there is an agreement- recites the joint sentence recommendation. Defendant pleads No Contest to 21CF410 Count 1- Possession of Methamphetamine as Party to a Crime without Repeater, Count 3- Possession of Drug Paraphernalia as Party to a Crime without Repeater, Count 5- Operating While Revoked, 22CF388 Count 1- Felony Bail Jumping without Repeater, 21CF1293 Count 1- Possession with the Intent to Deliver Methamphetamine (>50g) as Second or Subsequent Offense and as Repeater. Defendant acknowledges prior convictions. Defendant is advised of charges, maximum penalties, elements of the crime(s) and constitutional rights. Court accepts pleas and finds the Defendant guilty. Remaining charges are dismissed and read in, including all of 21TR3021. Discussion held regarding sentence credit. 
Court orders in 21CF410 and 22CF388- Defendant to provide DNA sample, pay the surcharge, and Court costs. 
Court withholds sentence in 21CF1293 and orders 4 years Probation with the following conditions: 180 days jail with Huber (if available), all stayed pending further order of the Court; AODA and follow through with recommendations; No contact with M.A. unless approved the by agent; No contact with A.L. unless approved by the agent; No contact with T.B., M.N.; No contact with any known drug dealers/users except in a therapeutic setting; Maintain absolute sobriety; Any conditions, programming or treatment per the agent and follow through with recommendations; Provide DNA sample and pay surcharge; Court costs. Court orders 3 days credit in 21CF1293 (imputed from 21CF410), if revoked. 
Court orders the Defendant to provide finger prints before leaving the building today (21CF1293).
Notice of Assignment of Judge - Return to Sender, Not Deliverable as Addressed, Unable to Forward
Status conference on April 20, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Conditions:
Defendant not to drive without a valid driver's license.
Comply with Pre-Trial Monitoring Services with possible testing based on monitoring level.

ADDRESS INFO for Bradly J. Richardson
Current: Homeless,   (Effective: 04-06-2022)
Prior: 916 Court Cir, Altoona, WI 54720

Conditions:
Defendant not to drive without a valid driver's license.
Comply with Pre-Trial Monitoring Services with possible testing based on monitoring level.

(2:00 PM cases 21CF410, 21CF1293, 22CF388 called.) Prosecuting District Attorney Peter J. Rindal in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Bradly J. Richardson in court. Attorney Robert Allen Thorson in court for Bradly J. Richardson.
Defendant waives formal reading of the complaint and time limits for preliminary hearing in 22CF388.
Court orders the defendant to have his finger prints taken today in 22CF388.
Defendant waives right to a preliminary hearing in cases 21CF1293, 22CF388 and Court accepts waivers.
Attorney Thorson advises close to a resolution on all cases and requests a status conference be scheduled.
Defendant updates address and phone number with the Court.
Status Conference scheduled for April 20, 2022 at 10 am (1/2 hour) in person.
